page.title: 11FARMING..CONSERVATION
page.content: {"Managing Field Edges for Wlldlife and {Game."} "With continued intensification in agriculture many wildlife habitats on farms are now at risk.Here are a few tips to make your field boundaries more valuable for wildlife. Manage hedges properly,keeping them to 5 or 6 feet in height.{Allow Ash, Oak {Wych Elm}and{Sycamore}to grow as mature trees.Why not plant a hedge using{Rown,Hawthorn}or{Hazel.}Plant a mixture of species to provide shelter and habitats for wildlife. Do not plant{Broom,Yew}or{Laurel}as these are poisonous to livestock. This spring leaves a few cereal headlands unsprayed. The Game Conservancy has discovered that doing this increases numbers of patridges by 300%. Other species also benefit at little reduction in output.
